step_1_login.title: 1. Login to User Dashboard
actions: Navigate to the user dashboard
Verify user is logged in (should show 'user@5glabx.com')
Check that navigation tabs are visible
expected_results: Dashboard loads without errors
User email displayed in header
Multiple tabs including '5GLabX + Test Manager' are visible

step_2_navigate_to_integration.title: 2. Navigate to Integrated Platform
actions: Click on '5GLabX + Test Manager' tab
Wait for platform to load (may take 5-10 seconds)
Look for green 'Full Integration Active' indicator
expected_results: Integration status shows 'Full Integration Active'
Sidebar with Test Manager section is visible
Backend Services Monitor should show initialized services

step_3_test_manager_access.title: 3. Access Test Manager in Sidebar
actions: Locate Test Manager section in left sidebar
Expand Test Manager if collapsed
Check for 'Test Library', 'Active Executions', 'Recent Results' tabs
Verify 'Backend Services' tab shows all services as 'Initialized'
expected_results: Test Manager sidebar fully functional
Multiple test categories visible (5G NR, LTE, VoLTE, O-RAN, V2X, NTN, NB-IoT)
Backend services show as initialized
Test case count should show 1800+ tests

step_4_test_case_loading.title: 4. Verify Test Cases Load from Supabase
actions: Click on 'Test Library' tab in Test Manager
Wait for test cases to load
Browse different categories (5G NR, LTE, etc.)
Check test case details and counts
expected_results: Test cases load from Supabase successfully
Categories show test counts (e.g., '5G NR: 450 tests')
Test case details include IEs, messages, and layer parameters
No loading errors in browser console

step_5_test_execution.title: 5. Execute Test Case
actions: Select a test case (e.g., '5G NR Initial Attach')
Click 'Execute Test' or 'Run' button
Monitor 'Active Executions' tab
Watch for progress indicators
expected_results: Test execution starts successfully
Progress bar shows execution status
Test moves from 'Active Executions' to 'Recent Results'
No execution errors in console

step_6_data_flow_verification.title: 6. Verify Data Flow to 5GLabX Components
actions: While test is running, navigate to different 5GLabX views:
- Check 'PHY Layer' view
- Check 'MAC Layer' view
- Check 'RRC Layer' view
- Check 'Logs View'
- Check 'Enhanced Log View'
Look for real-time data updates
expected_results: Protocol layer views show real-time data from test execution
Log views display test case messages and IEs
Enhanced log view shows detailed protocol information
Data updates automatically without manual refresh
All views synchronized with test execution timeline
